data.name: chapter-1/lesson-1/description
data.value: Join the army of devoted fans of armored machines from all parts of the world, and fight epic battles on photorealistic maps.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-1/hint-1/text
data.value: A 180-million strong army of players from all over the world.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-1/hint-2/text
data.value: Holder of two Guinness World Records and many other prestigious awards.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-1/hint-3/text
data.value: Over 500 combat vehicles of the mid-20th century.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-1/title
data.value: Welcome to the Game!

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-2/description
data.value: The game provides a considerable diversity of maps: elevation changes, a mixture of open terrain and urban areas, and a great many cover and ambush spots. As a result, you can always deploy the most suitable combat tactics to use in battle. Over thirty 1 x 1 kilometer maps in HD quality are at your disposal.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-2/title
data.value: Game Maps

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-3/hint-1/text
data.value: Use the mouse to rotate the turret and aim your gun.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-3/hint-2/text
data.value: Use the W, A, S, and D keys to control vehicle movement.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-3/hint-3/text
data.value: Wait for the gun to reload before firing.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-3/hint-4/text
data.value: Use Auto-Aim to fire at enemies on the move.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-3/title
data.value: Vehicle Controls

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-4/description
data.value: Aiming at an enemy vehicle will highlight its silhouette in red. Wait until you are fully aimed before firing.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-4/title
data.value: Causing Damage

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-5/description
data.value: A battle can be won either by destroying all enemy vehicles or upon successful capture of the enemy base. In Standard Battles, both teams have bases; in Assault mode, only the defending team has a base; in Encounter Battles there is only one neutral base that can be captured by any team.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-5/hint-1/text
data.value: Capture the enemy (or neutral) base.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-5/hint-2/text
data.value: Destroy all enemy vehicles.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-5/title
data.value: Victory Conditions

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-6/description
data.value: Each vehicle has modules that provide particular characteristics. You can spend experience points to research modules, and mount them for credits.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-6/title
data.value: Researching a Vehicle

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-7/hint-1/text
data.value: At present, the game provides ten tiers of vehicle. Each tier has a great many challenging and unique vehicles to research.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-7/hint-2/text
data.value: You require experience and credits to research and purchase new vehicles.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-7/title
data.value: Vehicle Tiers

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-8/hint-1/text
data.value: Gold represents valuable in-game currency that is purchased for real money.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-8/hint-2/text
data.value: Premium Account provides you 50% more experience and credits per battle.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-8/hint-3/text
data.value: Premium vehicles do not require researching, and earn 50% more credits and experience per battle.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-8/title
data.value: Premium Elements

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-9/description
data.value: As a newcomer, complete the Bootcamp to learn the game basics and receive valuable rewards.

data.name: chapter-1/lesson-9/title
data.value: Bootcamp

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-1/description
data.value: You receive (depending on your performance) experience and credits for each battle. Random Battles include the following modes: Standard Battle, Assault, Encounter, and Grand Battle.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-1/title
data.value: Random Battle

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-10/description
data.value: Battles of manually assembled teams of 7 players each, for Tier VI–VIII vehicles, with one team defending two separate bases. A victorious team earns additional credits and experience.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-10/title
data.value: Team Battle

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-11/description
data.value: Battles for Tier X vehicles, available on particular dates. Winning battles increases your rank, losing battles may result in a lost rank. In Ranked battles, players can earn special in-game currency—bonds.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-11/title
data.value: Ranked Battle

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-2/hint-1/text
data.value: Two teams defend their bases and attack each other.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-2/hint-2/text
data.value: This mode is available to vehicles of all tiers.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-2/hint-3/text
data.value: The teams are matched automatically, with 15 players on each.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-2/title
data.value: Random Battles: Standard Battle

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-3/hint-1/text
data.value: One team attacks the enemy base, the other one defends its base.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-3/hint-2/text
data.value: This mode is available after researching Tier VI vehicles.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-3/hint-3/text
data.value: The teams are matched automatically, with 15 players on each.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-3/title
data.value: Random Battles: Assault

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-4/hint-1/text
data.value: The battle features only one neutral base, and both teams attempt to capture it.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-4/hint-2/text
data.value: This mode is available after researching Tier IV vehicles.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-4/hint-3/text
data.value: The teams are matched automatically, with 15 players on each.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-4/title
data.value: Random Battles: Encounter

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-5/hint-1/text
data.value: This mode features a large map where the battle is played under Standard rules.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-5/hint-2/text
data.value: The mode is available only to Tier X vehicles.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-5/hint-3/text
data.value: The teams are matched automatically, with 30 players on each.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-5/title
data.value: Random Battles: Grand Battle

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-6/description
data.value: Complete all missions to get acquainted with all the strengths and weaknesses of each vehicle type. The battles are fought in a 15vs15 format, where all vehicles but your own are controlled by AI. The difficulty level of the mission determines the total amount of your rewards. The mode is available to Tier IV-X vehicles.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-6/title
data.value: Missions by Vehicle Type

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-7/description
data.value: Hone your skills with other players on any map. You receive no rewards for battle results, and the vehicles are repaired for free. Players only need to purchase shells and consumables.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-7/title
data.value: Team Training

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-8/description
data.value: Sharpen your skills in Tier I-II vehicles by fighting against AI (bots), and receive rewards for the first 10 battles, in case you have not yet fought 10 Random Battles.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-8/title
data.value: Proving Ground

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-9/description
data.value: Battles for clan players and legionnaires in Tier VI-X vehicles. You and your clan have a chance to earn solid bonuses to Combat and Free Experience, Crew Experience and credits. Visit the portal for more details.

data.name: chapter-2/lesson-9/title
data.value: Stronghold: Battles

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-1/description
data.value: Modules reflect the technical characteristics of a vehicle. There are particular unified modules that can be mounted on different vehicles.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-1/hint-1/text
data.value: The turret is responsible for the view range of a vehicle. It has particular armor and turret traverse speed.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-1/hint-2/text
data.value: The gun is responsible for the following: damage, armor penetration, damage per minute, dispersion, and aiming time.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-1/hint-3/text
data.value: The engine is responsible for the vehicle's dynamic characteristics. It has a particular chance of ignition when receiving damage.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-1/hint-4/text
data.value: The suspension is responsible for a vehicle's load capacity and traverse speed.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-1/hint-5/text
data.value: The radio is responsible for the display range of vehicles on the minimap.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-1/title
data.value: Vehicle Modules

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-10/hint-1/text
data.value: 5% of all earned experience is received as Free Experience.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-10/hint-2/text
data.value: You can use it to research any module or vehicle, or to accelerate crew training.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-10/hint-3/text
data.value: You can convert surplus Combat Experience from Elite vehicles to Free Experience.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-10/title
data.value: Free Experience

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-11/hint-1/text
data.value: Elite status is given to vehicles with all available modules and technical branches researched, including all adjacent vehicles in the Tech Tree.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-11/hint-2/text
data.value: Combat Experience earned on an Elite vehicle can be converted to Free Experience for gold.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-11/hint-3/text
data.value: When accelerating crew training in the Garage, all future earned experience will be added to the crew.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-11/title
data.value: Elite Vehicles

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-12/description
data.value: The game provides vehicles of various nations. Go to the TECH TREE screen and click on the flags in the left area to view and study all available vehicles.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-12/title
data.value: Tech Tree

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-2/description
data.value: Use consumables to improve the characteristics of vehicles or the performance of crews, repair damaged modules or treat injured crew members in battle. You can equip up to three different types of consumable at one time.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-2/title
data.value: Consumables

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-3/description
data.value: Before entering a battle, make sure you load ammunition, otherwise you risk running out of ammunition in the heat of battle. Use the 1, 2, and 3 keys to switch between different types of shell.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-3/title
data.value: Ammunition

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-4/description
data.value: Use equipment to improve the technical characteristics of your vehicles. You can mount equipment from one vehicle to another (simple equipment—for free, complex equipment—for 10 gold, improved equipment—for 200 bonds).

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-4/title
data.value: Equipment

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-5/description
data.value: When purchasing a vehicle, you can add a crew and select its training level. You can also transfer the crew from another vehicle and retrain it.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-5/hint-1/text
data.value: The Commander affects the vehicle's view range and improves the performance of the other crew members.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-5/hint-2/text
data.value: The Gunner affects the turret traverse speed, gun aiming and firing accuracy.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-5/hint-3/text
data.value: The Loader affects the gun loading time.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-5/hint-4/text
data.value: The Driver affects the dynamic characteristics of your vehicle.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-5/hint-5/text
data.value: The Radio Operator affects the maximum signal range.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-5/title
data.value: Crew

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-6/description
data.value: Additional perks and skills are available to crew members only after their major qualification is trained to 100%. Click on the "plus" icon to select the available perk or skill from the list.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-6/title
data.value: Skills and Perks

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-7/hint-1/text
data.value: Your vehicle's crew receives experience in battles.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-7/hint-2/text
data.value: After training the major qualification of your crew members to 100%, you can select their available perks or skills.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-7/hint-3/text
data.value: You can purchase a crew trained to 100% or accelerate crew training right in the Garage.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-7/title
data.value: Crew Training

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-8/description
data.value: Transfer is available only to crews of the same nation. Your Barracks have a limited number of bunks (you can purchase additional bunks). You can transfer crew to a Premium vehicle of the same type without penalty.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-8/hint-1/text
data.value: When selling a vehicle, you can dismiss crew members or send them to the Barracks.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-8/hint-2/text
data.value: When transferring a crew to another vehicle, remember that they will be ineffective without retraining.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-8/hint-3/text
data.value: Make sure you retrain the crew for the new vehicle before entering a battle.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-8/title
data.value: Crew Transfer and Retraining

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-9/hint-1/text
data.value: Combat Experience is the resource that is earned for a particular contribution in battle.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-9/hint-2/text
data.value: Combat Experience, earned on a particular vehicle, is used for researching its modules and subsequent vehicles.

data.name: chapter-3/lesson-9/title
data.value: Combat Experience

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-1/description
data.value: The most maneuverable, fast, compact, yet vulnerable type of vehicle in the game. Light tanks are born scouts: they detect and spot enemy vehicles, doing their best to stay alive in battle for as long as possible.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-1/hint-1/text
data.value: The fastest vehicles in the game.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-1/hint-2/text
data.value: Demonstrate excellent dynamics and maneuverability.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-1/hint-3/text
data.value: Compact dimensions, high concealment.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-1/title
data.value: Light Tanks

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-2/description
data.value: Medium tanks are the most versatile units in World of Tanks. They are quite dynamic and maneuverable for effective performance at medium range, and have a sufficient number of hit points to survive the shots of high-caliber guns.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-2/hint-1/text
data.value: Balanced and multifunctional vehicles.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-2/hint-2/text
data.value: They are maneuverable enough to appear in the right place at the right time.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-2/hint-3/text
data.value: Effective as support vehicles on the second line of attack.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-2/title
data.value: Medium Tanks

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-3/description
data.value: Heavy tanks are the assault vehicles to break through the enemy defenses. Low mobility makes them quite an easy target for enemy SPGs, but reliable armor can resist a good many shots.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-3/hint-1/text
data.value: Heavily armored vehicles with low mobility.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-3/hint-2/text
data.value: High-caliber guns.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-3/hint-3/text
data.value: A large number of hit points and high survivability.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-3/title
data.value: Heavy Tanks

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-4/description
data.value: In concealed positions for ambush firing, tank destroyers can cause devastating damage from long distances. However, low dynamic characteristics make these vehicles quite vulnerable in close combat.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-4/hint-1/text
data.value: Fast-aiming guns with high accuracy and penetration.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-4/hint-2/text
data.value: High damage per shot.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-4/hint-3/text
data.value: High concealment in a stationary position.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-4/title
data.value: Tank Destroyers

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-5/description
data.value: SPGs are always positioned behind the allied lines, and can fire at targets in almost any part of the map. They can hide and survive for a long time, while they have almost no chance in close combat due to weak armor and low maneuverability.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-5/hint-1/text
data.value: A long range support to allies.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-5/hint-2/text
data.value: A quite different style of gameplay.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-5/hint-3/text
data.value: Can cause stun that reduces the technical characteristics of enemy vehicles.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-5/title
data.value: SPGs

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-6/description
data.value: 1. LT—front line, passive or active spotting. 2. MT—flanking maneuvers, destroying the enemy scouts, supporting the attacking allied vehicles. 3. HT—breaking through or holding the main front. 4. TD—long-range fire from the second line, destruction of heavy tanks. 5. SPG—firing at enemy vehicles from long range, smoking enemy vehicles out of ambush spots.

data.name: chapter-4/lesson-6/title
data.value: Battle Roles

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-1/hint-1/text
data.value: The more accurate the gun, the less likely it is that the shell diverts from the target during firing.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-1/hint-2/text
data.value: Before firing, wait for the aiming circle to snap onto the target.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-1/hint-3/text
data.value: Firing without full aim is much less effective.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-1/title
data.value: Gun Dispersion

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-10/hint-1/text
data.value: These shells cause the highest potential damage, but demonstrate the lowest penetration and flight speed.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-10/hint-2/text
data.value: When hitting a screen or during a non-penetration of enemy armor, they explode and cause splash damage.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-10/hint-3/text
data.value: They always explode on impact and never ricochet.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-10/title
data.value: High-Explosive Shells

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-11/description
data.value: The view range of each vehicle is calculated in meters, and displayed in technical characteristics. 445 meters is the maximum value. Improving the standard view range of your vehicle allows for more effective spotting of concealed enemies that are within the view range circle. It presents the most important parameter for light tanks. 1—The enemy vehicle is spotted within your view range. 2—The enemy vehicle is spotted after firing. 3—Concealed vehicle behind bushes. 4—Concealed vehicle behind a building.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-11/title
data.value: View Range

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-12/description
data.value: The value of this parameter is always 565 meters. It represents the maximum distance at which allied and enemy vehicles are visible.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-12/title
data.value: Maximal Draw Circle

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-13/description
data.value: You always spot enemy vehicles within 50 meters, regardless of cover or obstacles they are hiding behind.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-13/title
data.value: Vehicles Within 50 Meters are Always Visible

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-14/description
data.value: Ramming vehicles causes damage proportional to their difference in mass, speed of movement, and armor thickness in the area of impact. When playing in heavy and fast vehicles, take your chance and ram enemy vehicles to cause them considerable damage.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-14/title
data.value: Ramming

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-2/description
data.value: Stationary vehicles demonstrate better firing accuracy than when firing on the move. Avoid firing at distant enemies on the move: the chances to hit the target are extremely low, while your vehicle will be spotted upon firing.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-2/title
data.value: Higher Dispersion on the Move

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-3/description
data.value: Each shell has its own flight speed and requires a particular time to reach the target. Aim at the front or ahead of the enemy vehicle to hit a moving target. Study your gun and try to get used to its shell flight speed—you will be able to lead the targets at long distances with a higher rate of accuracy.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-3/title
data.value: Firing at Moving Targets (Leading Targets)

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-4/description
data.value: Auto-aim will automatically follow an enemy vehicle, but one should use it wisely. The auto-aim catches the geometrical center of a vehicle that may be heavily armored.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-4/hint-1/text
data.value: Use the right mouse button to auto-aim at an enemy vehicle; clicking again will deactivate it.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-4/hint-2/text
data.value: This option is quite beneficial when firing on the move.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-4/hint-3/text
data.value: Auto-aim does not lead targets.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-4/title
data.value: Auto-Aim

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-5/description
data.value: The green marker indicates the highest chance of armor penetration. Even without penetration and causing damage, you have a high chance to damage the external module of an enemy vehicle. The red marker indicates the minimum (or simply zero) chance to penetrate its armor.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-5/title
data.value: Penetration

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-6/description
data.value: A gun requires reloading before firing again.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-6/title
data.value: Gun Loading

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-7/hint-1/text
data.value: The penetration of these shells decreases with distance traveled, but still demonstrates good normalization.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-7/hint-2/text
data.value: They lose penetration potential when passing through destructible objects.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-7/hint-3/text
data.value: The shells demonstrate frequent ricochets when hitting the armor at an angle of 70 degrees or more.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-7/title
data.value: Armor-Piercing Shells

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-8/description
data.value: Armor-Piercing Composite Rigid Shells

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-8/hint-1/text
data.value: High flight speed and penetration, but bad shell normalization.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-8/hint-2/text
data.value: The penetration of these shells decreases with distance traveled and when passing through destructible objects.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-8/hint-3/text
data.value: The shells demonstrate frequent ricochets when hitting the armor at an angle of 70 degrees or more.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-8/title
data.value: Armor-Piercing Composite Rigid Shells

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-9/hint-1/text
data.value: The shells demonstrate high penetration potential that does not decrease with distance traveled.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-9/hint-2/text
data.value: They cannot penetrate obstacles or destructible objects, and may not penetrate vehicle screens.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-9/hint-3/text
data.value: Demonstrate frequent ricochets when hitting the armor at an angle of 85 degrees or more.

data.name: chapter-5/lesson-9/title
data.value: High-Explosive Anti-Tank Shells

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-1/description
data.value: Each vehicle has armor. All vehicles usually have well-armored front, pretty reliable turret (or cabin), and quite weak side and rear armor. Each vehicle has a unique armor scheme, with its own strong and weak areas.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-1/title
data.value: Armor Difference

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-10/description
data.value: Damaged fuel tanks will certainly catch fire once destroyed in battle. Damaged fuel tanks do not affect a vehicle's performance: the yellow indication simply informs a player of potential ignition on the next hit to the module.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-10/title
data.value: Damaged Fuel Tanks

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-11/description
data.value: A damaged ammo rack doubles the gun loading time. A destroyed ammo rack will detonate, destroying your vehicle in a blink of an eye.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-11/title
data.value: Damaged Ammo Rack

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-12/description
data.value: A damaged radio does not affect a vehicle's performance and continues to operate. However, a destroyed radio halves your signal range, which may impede your understanding of the current battle situation.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-12/title
data.value: Damaged Radio

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-13/description
data.value: An injured Commander reduces the view range, removes the Commander's bonuses from other crew members, and disables the Sixth Sense Perk.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-13/title
data.value: Injured Commander

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-14/description
data.value: An injured Gunner halves a vehicle's aim and turret traverse speed. In case the Gunner performs several functions, they will all be affected by this crew member's injury.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-14/title
data.value: Injured Gunner

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-15/description
data.value: An injured Driver halves the vehicle's movement and hull traverse speed. In case the Driver performs several functions, they will all be affected by this crew member's injury.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-15/title
data.value: Injured Driver

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-16/description
data.value: An injured Radio Operator halves the vehicle's signal range. In case the Radio Operator performs several functions, they will all be affected by this crew member's injury.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-16/title
data.value: Injured Radio Operator

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-17/description
data.value: An injured Loader doubles the vehicle's gun loading time. If the Loader performs several functions, they will all be affected by this crew member's injury.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-17/title
data.value: Injured Loader

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-18/description
data.value: When falling from an obstacle, you can cause damage to both your vehicle and to any enemy you land on. When passing through deep water, remember that you have 10 seconds until the vehicle will drown. When overturned, you can only hope your allies may give you a hand and turn your vehicle back again.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-18/title
data.value: Drowning, Overturning, and Falling

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-19/description
data.value: Any type of vegetation (except grass) conceals your vehicle from enemies. Make sure that bushes and treetops completely cover your vehicle. Firing removes all vehicle concealment bonuses within a 15-meter radius. Make sure your vehicle is 15 meters away if you want to fire from behind bushes.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-19/title
data.value: Vegetation and Concealment

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-2/description
data.value: When your vehicle is exposed to enemy fire, try to avoid being hit at a 90 degree angle. Angle your vehicle properly to increase the chance to deflect enemy shells.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-2/title
data.value: Blocking Damage with Side Armor

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-20/description
data.value: A concealed vehicle is invisible to enemy vehicles. Use the Camouflage Net equipment, camouflages, designated directive and the Concealment skill to boost the concealment characteristics of your vehicle. Remember: firing reveals your position.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-20/title
data.value: Vehicle Concealment and Revealing Factors

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-3/description
data.value: When fighting against enemy vehicles, try to make the most of the available cover like rocks, destroyed vehicles or buildings. This will save you a great many hit points.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-3/title
data.value: Use Cover to Hide Your Vehicle's Weak Spots

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-4/description
data.value: Make sure you take advantage of map terrain. Hide your vehicle's hull in terrain irregularities and minimize its visible silhouette. You can fire from behind a hill without being exposed to direct enemy fire.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-4/title
data.value: Use Terrain Irregularities

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-5/description
data.value: A damaged module increases the chance of track destruction. A destroyed track immobilizes your vehicle for a short time.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-5/title
data.value: Damaged Suspension

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-6/description
data.value: Firing with a damaged gun has quite a low chance of hitting the target. A destroyed gun cannot fire until it is repaired to at least a damaged state.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-6/title
data.value: Damaged Gun

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-7/description
data.value: Damaged observation devices do not affect the view range, unlike destroyed devices, which halves the view range.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-7/title
data.value: Damaged Observation Devices

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-8/description
data.value: A damaged turret ring slows down the turret traverse speed. When the mechanism is destroyed, the turret remains static until it is repaired. You will struggle to contribute to battle with an immobile turret.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-8/title
data.value: Damaged Turret Ring

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-9/description
data.value: A damaged engine considerably reduces all dynamic characteristics of your vehicle. A destroyed engine makes a vehicle immobile until it is repaired. Hitting a damaged engine has a chance of setting your vehicle on fire.

data.name: chapter-6/lesson-9/title
data.value: Damaged Engine

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-1/description
data.value: The minimap provides a better understanding of the general picture of the battle situation. Apart from the positions of allies, the minimap also displays the positions of spotted enemy vehicles, as well as the range of your current and maximum view, camera direction beam and maximum draw circle.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-1/title
data.value: Minimap

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-10/hint-1/text
data.value: Create a Platoon of 2–3 players and fight as a team.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-10/hint-2/text
data.value: Additional experience per battle for Tier IV vehicles or higher.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-10/hint-3/text
data.value: Only vehicles of same tier are available to fight in a Platoon; only one SPG can join a Platoon.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-10/title
data.value: Playing in a Platoon

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-2/description
data.value: All commands from the menu are duplicated on the F3–F8 hotkeys. The Attacking command is assigned to the T key by default.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-2/hint-1/text
data.value: Hold the Z key and hover on the command to select it.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-2/title
data.value: Display Command Menu

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-3/description
data.value: A special account status that gives you 50% more credits and experience per battle. It can be purchased for gold for a particular period, or received for completion of particular missions, as well as for participation in special events.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-3/title
data.value: Premium Account

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-4/description
data.value: Gold represents valuable premium currency. It cannot purchase any advantages in the game, but considerably simplifies the game process. Gold can be used to enlarge the Garage and the Barracks, purchase days of Premium Account and Premium vehicles, demount complex equipment, convert experience to Free Experience, and much more.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-4/title
data.value: Gold

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-5/description
data.value: Credits represent the game currency that is received for particular contributions in a battle. Credits are used for vehicle repairs, purchasing new modules and vehicles, resupplying ammunition, equipment, and much more.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-5/title
data.value: Credits

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-6/description
data.value: Bonds represent a unique in-game currency earned in Ranked Battles, as well as for receiving particular awards. Certain unique items can be purchased for bonds, including improved equipment and directives.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-6/title
data.value: Bonds

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-7/description
data.value: Premium vehicles represent special vehicles that require no further research and are purchased in top configuration. Playing in these vehicles earns more credits and experience in battle, they can use the crew from another vehicle of the same type and nation without retraining, and repair of a Premium vehicle is usually cheaper. They present a great opportunity to players who want to save time.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-7/title
data.value: Premium Vehicles

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-8/hint-1/text
data.value: Communicate with your allies in a battle (the Enter key) or create a private channel after the end of a battle.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-8/hint-2/text
data.value: Add players to your Friends list to find Platoon members for future battles.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-8/hint-3/text
data.value: By using offensive words or distracting other players from the battle, you violate the Game Rules and may be punished.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-8/title
data.value: Social Activity

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-9/hint-1/text
data.value: You receive various awards for special achievements in a battle.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-9/hint-2/text
data.value: This rating represents the total sum of game skills and experience. The rating is displayed to all players.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-9/hint-3/text
data.value: Rating by vehicles and achievements in Random Battles.

data.name: chapter-7/lesson-9/title
data.value: Service Record

data.name: main_page/chapter/attack_basics
data.value: Attack Basics

data.name: main_page/chapter/defence_basics
data.value: Defense Basics

data.value: Game Modes

data.value: For Newcomers

data.name: main_page/chapter/others
data.value: Other

data.value: Player's Vehicle

data.value: Vehicle Types
